byline.contributor: Karam Shoumali contributed reporting from Istanbul, and Kamil Kakol from Sulaimaniya, Iraq.

abstract: Syrian Kurds who have borne brunt of fight against Islamic State worry their sacrifices will be overlooked; view Turkey's recent America-supported military incursion into Syria as threat to their bid for autonomous region and latest in long history of betrayals by Western partners.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: Throughout history, Washington and other Western powers have used the Kurds for their ends, then abandoned them when it became expedient.
snippet: Throughout history, Washington and other Western powers have used the Kurds for their ends, then abandoned them when it became expedient....

headline.main: Kurds Fear the U.S. Will Again Betray Them, in Syria
headline.print_headline: Kurds Fear the U.S. Will Again Betray Them, in Syria
